segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 3. Pañcaṅgikavagga
segments.en: 3. With Five Factors

segments.pli: 30. Nāgitasutta
segments.en: 30. With Nāgita

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṃghena saddhiṃ yena icchānaṅgalaṃ nāma kosalānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a village of the Kosalan brahmins named Icchānaṅgala.

segments.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
segments.en: He stayed in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.

segments.pli: Assosuṃ kho icchānaṅgalakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
segments.en: The brahmins and householders of Icchānaṅgala heard:

segments.pli: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito icchānaṅgalaṃ anuppatto; icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
segments.en: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Icchānaṅgala. He is staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.

segments.pli: Taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
segments.en: He has this good reputation:

segments.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi, satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti’.
segments.en: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

segments.pli: So imaṃ lokaṃ sadevakaṃ samārakaṃ sabrahmakaṃ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṃ pajaṃ sadevamanussaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
segments.en: He has realized with his own insight this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.

segments.pli: So dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
segments.en: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

segments.pli: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṃ arahataṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

segments.pli: Atha kho icchānaṅgalakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tassā rattiyā accayena pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya yena icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhaṃsu uccāsaddamahāsaddā.
segments.en: Then, when the night had passed, they took many different foods and went to the forest near Icchānaṅgala, where they stood outside the gates making a dreadful racket.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgito bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti.
segments.en: Now, at that time Venerable Nāgita was the Buddha’s attendant.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ nāgitaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Nāgita,

segments.pli: “ke pana kho, nāgita, uccāsaddamahāsaddā, kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope”ti?
segments.en: “Nāgita, who’s making that dreadful racket? You’d think it was fishermen hauling in a catch!”

segments.pli: “Ete, bhante, icchānaṅgalakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitā bhagavantaññeva uddissa bhikkhusaṃghañcā”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, it’s these brahmins and householders of Icchānaṅgala. They’ve brought many different foods, and they’re standing outside the gates wanting to offer it specially to the Buddha and the mendicant Saṅgha.”

segments.pli: “Māhaṃ, nāgita, yasena samāgamaṃ, mā ca mayā yaso.
segments.en: “Nāgita, may I never become famous. May fame not come to me.

segments.pli: Yo kho, nāgita, nayimassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
segments.en: There are those who can’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

segments.pli: So taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyyā”ti.
segments.en: Let them enjoy the filthy, lazy pleasure of possessions, honor, and popularity.”

segments.pli: “Adhivāsetu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, adhivāsetu sugato;
segments.en: “Sir, may the Blessed One please relent now! May the Holy One relent!

segments.pli: adhivāsanakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
segments.en: Now is the time for the Buddha to relent.

segments.pli: Yena yeneva dāni bhagavā gamissati taṃninnāva gamissanti brāhmaṇagahapatikā negamā ceva jānapadā ca.
segments.en: Wherever the Buddha now goes, the brahmins and householders will incline the same way, as will the people of town and country.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, thullaphusitake deve vassante yathāninnaṃ udakāni pavattanti;
segments.en: It’s like when it rains heavily and the water flows downhill.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhante, yena yeneva dāni bhagavā gamissati, taṃninnāva gamissanti brāhmaṇagahapatikā negamā ceva jānapadā ca.
segments.en: In the same way, wherever the Buddha now goes, the brahmins and householders will incline the same way, as will the people of town and country.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Tathā hi, bhante, bhagavato sīlapaññāṇan”ti.
segments.en: Because of the Buddha’s ethics and wisdom.”

segments.pli: “Māhaṃ, nāgita, yasena samāgamaṃ, mā ca mayā yaso.
segments.en: “Nāgita, may I never become famous. May fame not come to me.

segments.pli: Yo kho, nāgita, nayimassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, yassāhaṃ nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
segments.en: There are those who can’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.

segments.pli: So taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyya.
segments.en: Let them enjoy the filthy, lazy pleasure of possessions, honor, and popularity.

segments.pli: Asitapītakhāyitasāyitassa kho, nāgita, uccārapassāvo—
segments.en: What you eat, drink, chew, and taste ends up as excrement and urine.

segments.pli: eso tassa nissando.
segments.en: This is its outcome.

segments.pli: Piyānaṃ kho, nāgita, vipariṇāmaññathābhāvā uppajjanti sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā—
segments.en: When loved ones decay and perish, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress arise.

segments.pli: eso tassa nissando.
segments.en: This is its outcome.

segments.pli: Asubhanimittānuyogaṃ anuyuttassa kho, nāgita, subhanimitte pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti—
segments.en: When you pursue meditation on the feature of ugliness, revulsion at the feature of beauty becomes stabilized.

segments.pli: eso tassa nissando.
segments.en: This is its outcome.

segments.pli: Chasu kho, nāgita, phassāyatanesu aniccānupassino viharato phasse pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti—
segments.en: When you meditate observing impermanence in the six fields of contact, revulsion at contact becomes stabilized.

segments.pli: eso tassa nissando.
segments.en: This is its outcome.

segments.pli: Pañcasu kho, nāgita, upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassino viharato upādāne pāṭikulyatā saṇṭhāti—
segments.en: When you meditate observing rise and fall in the five grasping aggregates, revulsion at grasping becomes stabilized.

segments.pli: eso tassa nissando”ti.
segments.en: This is its outcome.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Pañcaṅgikavaggo tatiyo.
Dve agāravupakkilesā,
Dussīlānuggahitena ca;
Vimuttisamādhipañcaṅgikā,
Caṅkamaṃ nāgitena cāti.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha tells Venerable Nāgita how he dislikes noisy crowds, and wishes never to become famous.
